intro: Dyssodia alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough or hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
